events.name: Devastating flood in Kabul, May 2022
events.wd_description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.
events.description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.

events.name: Impact on Kabul and provinces
events.wd_description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.
events.description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.

events.name: Humanitarian crisis and response
events.wd_description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.
events.description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.

events.name: Severe flooding in southern China, June 2022
events.wd_label: Severe flooding in southern China, June 2022
events.wd_description: Tens of thousands of people were evacuated due to severe flooding in southern China, particularly affecting the Guangdong and Jiangxi provinces, with more rain expected and significant disruptions in daily life.
events.description: Tens of thousands of people were evacuated due to severe flooding in southern China, particularly affecting the Guangdong and Jiangxi provinces, with more rain expected and significant disruptions in daily life.

events.name: Flooding in Guangdong
events.wd_description: The flooding in Guangdong led to the suspension of classes, office work, and public transportation, with tens of thousands of people evacuated and widespread damage in Shaoguan, Heyuan, and Meizhou.
events.description: The flooding in Guangdong led to the suspension of classes, office work, and public transportation, with tens of thousands of people evacuated and widespread damage in Shaoguan, Heyuan, and Meizhou.

events.name: Impact on Jiangxi province
events.wd_description: In Jiangxi province, nearly 500,000 people have had their homes damaged and lives uprooted due to the flooding, with similar levels of impact as in Guangdong.
events.description: In Jiangxi province, nearly 500,000 people have had their homes damaged and lives uprooted due to the flooding, with similar levels of impact as in Guangdong.

events.name: Government response and historical context
events.wd_description: The government has invested heavily in flood control, including projects like the Three Gorges Dam, following the devastating floods of 1998, which resulted in over 2,000 deaths and the destruction of nearly 3 million homes.
events.description: The government has invested heavily in flood control, including projects like the Three Gorges Dam, following the devastating floods of 1998, which resulted in over 2,000 deaths and the destruction of nearly 3 million homes.

events.name: US troop redeployment to Somalia
events.wd_description: President Biden has approved the redeployment of fewer than 500 US troops to Somalia to restore military presence and counter al-Shabaab forces, reversing former President Trump's withdrawal.
events.description: President Biden has approved the redeployment of fewer than 500 US troops to Somalia to restore military presence and counter al-Shabaab forces, reversing former President Trump's withdrawal.

events.name: Trump’s withdrawal policy
events.wd_description: Former President Trump ordered the withdrawal of US troops from Somalia in early 2020 as part of efforts to reduce US involvement in international politics.
events.description: Former President Trump ordered the withdrawal of US troops from Somalia in early 2020 as part of efforts to reduce US involvement in international politics.

events.name: Biden’s redeployment decision
events.wd_description: President Biden approved the redeployment of fewer than 500 troops to Somalia in consultation with the Somali government to counter the threat posed by al-Shabaab.
events.description: President Biden approved the redeployment of fewer than 500 troops to Somalia in consultation with the Somali government to counter the threat posed by al-Shabaab.

events.name: Impact of troop withdrawal
events.wd_description: The withdrawal of US troops was described as “abrupt and sudden” by a Pentagon official, strengthening the morale of al-Shabaab forces.
events.description: The withdrawal of US troops was described as “abrupt and sudden” by a Pentagon official, strengthening the morale of al-Shabaab forces.

events.name: US counter-terrorism strategy
events.wd_description: While no targeted strikes on specific leaders of al-Shabaab have been confirmed, emphasis is on other non-military components of the US counter-terrorism strategy in Somalia.
events.description: While no targeted strikes on specific leaders of al-Shabaab have been confirmed, emphasis is on other non-military components of the US counter-terrorism strategy in Somalia.

events.name: Chinese EV battery material manufacturers scaling up production
events.wd_label: Chinese EV battery material manufacturers scaling up production
events.wd_description: China's top EV battery material manufacturers will invest at least 71 billion yuan to scale up output, with plans to triple production capacity in some products.
events.description: China's top EV battery material manufacturers will invest at least 71 billion yuan to scale up output, with plans to triple production capacity in some products.

events.name: Investment plans
events.wd_description: The planned investments cover all key components of lithium-ion batteries, with some companies not disclosing timelines or production expansion volumes.
events.description: The planned investments cover all key components of lithium-ion batteries, with some companies not disclosing timelines or production expansion volumes.

events.name: Market share growth
events.wd_description: Chinese suppliers have grown their market shares by driving down prices. Yunnan Energy New Material Group (Semcorp) aims to increase its global market share from 31% in 2021 to 50% in 2025.
events.description: Chinese suppliers have grown their market shares by driving down prices. Yunnan Energy New Material Group (Semcorp) aims to increase its global market share from 31% in 2021 to 50% in 2025.

events.name: Semcorp's expansion plans
events.wd_description: Semcorp plans to build factories in Yunnan, Jiangsu, Hubei, Chongqing, Hungary, and potentially North America, with an expected annual production capacity of 16 billion sq. meters by 2025.
events.description: Semcorp plans to build factories in Yunnan, Jiangsu, Hubei, Chongqing, Hungary, and potentially North America, with an expected annual production capacity of 16 billion sq. meters by 2025.

events.name: Customer base
events.wd_description: Semcorp's customers include Chinese EV battery makers CATL and BYD, as well as Japan's Panasonic and South Korea's Samsung and LG groups.
events.description: Semcorp's customers include Chinese EV battery makers CATL and BYD, as well as Japan's Panasonic and South Korea's Samsung and LG groups.

events.name: Revenue growth
events.wd_description: Semcorp reported an 86% jump in revenue last year to a record 7.9 billion yuan, aiming to raise non-Chinese customers' share of sales volume to 40% by 2025.
events.description: Semcorp reported an 86% jump in revenue last year to a record 7.9 billion yuan, aiming to raise non-Chinese customers' share of sales volume to 40% by 2025.

events.name: BTR New Material Group's expansion
events.wd_description: BTR New Material Group plans to nearly triple annual capacity to over 400,000 tons in the medium to long term, up from 140,000-plus tons at the end of 2021.
events.description: BTR New Material Group plans to nearly triple annual capacity to over 400,000 tons in the medium to long term, up from 140,000-plus tons at the end of 2021.

events.name: Jiangsu Guotai International Group's expansion
events.wd_description: Jiangsu Guotai International Group is building new plants in Zhejiang, Fujian, and Poland.
events.description: Jiangsu Guotai International Group is building new plants in Zhejiang, Fujian, and Poland.

events.name: Japanese competitors' market share decline
events.wd_description: Japanese companies once held an advantage in battery materials but lost their lead to Chinese competitors, with Chinese suppliers now holding global market shares ranging from 62% to 81%.
events.description: Japanese companies once held an advantage in battery materials but lost their lead to Chinese competitors, with Chinese suppliers now holding global market shares ranging from 62% to 81%.

events.name: Price competition and production readiness
events.wd_description: Chinese suppliers succeed through price competition and readiness to take on large orders, keeping costs down by buying vast supplies of materials.
events.description: Chinese suppliers succeed through price competition and readiness to take on large orders, keeping costs down by buying vast supplies of materials.

events.name: Government support
events.wd_description: Chinese government support has helped the industry grow, with Semcorp receiving over 100 million yuan of profit from state subsidies each year between 2019 and 2021.
events.description: Chinese government support has helped the industry grow, with Semcorp receiving over 100 million yuan of profit from state subsidies each year between 2019 and 2021.

events.name: Japanese competitors' strategies
events.wd_description: Japanese companies plan to expand production in the U.S. and Europe, focusing on higher-margin applications to avoid direct competition with Chinese suppliers.
events.description: Japanese companies plan to expand production in the U.S. and Europe, focusing on higher-margin applications to avoid direct competition with Chinese suppliers.

events.name: Concerns of supply glut
events.wd_description: China's rapid production expansion has fueled concerns of a supply glut, with predictions that production demand for some materials will far exceed global demand in 2025.
events.description: China's rapid production expansion has fueled concerns of a supply glut, with predictions that production demand for some materials will far exceed global demand in 2025.
